Package controller

Class addPartForm

java.lang.Object
controller.addPartForm
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class addPartForm extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This controller class allows to add InHouse and Outsourced object of type Part to the ObservableList allParts of the Inventory class.

The addPartForm class implements the Initializable interface. Provides control to the data flow into objects and updates the view addPartForm FXML file.

Author:
Myriam Drouin-Sagar

  • Method Details

    • onInHouseAddPart

      public void onInHouseAddPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Sets the Machine ID/Company Name label to "Machine ID". The label is populated when the In-House radio button is selected by the user.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by the In-House radio button inHouseAddPartRadio when selected by the user (never used)

    • onOutsourcedAddPart

      public void onOutsourcedAddPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Sets the Machine ID/Company Name label to "Company Name". The label is populated when the Outsourced radio button is selected by the user.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by the Outsourced radio button outsourcedAddPartRadio when selected by the user (never used)

    • onCancelAddPart

      public void onCancelAddPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Cancels the addParForm and returns to the mainForm.

      It displays a confirmation dialog box. If confirmed, a call to the function returnToMainScreen will redirect the user to the mainForm.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by the Cancel button cancelAddPartButton when clicked by the user
      Throws:
      IOException - from the FXMLLoader in the method returnToMainScreen

    • onSaveAddPart

      public void onSaveAddPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Gets and saves a new InHouse or Outsourced object and its values entered by the user in the addPartForm and loads the mainForm.

      It adds a new object of type Part to the ObservableList allParts by calling the addPart method of the Inventory class.

      A call to the minMaxValid method and invValid method is made, and an error message is displayed if min or inv is not valid. It gets the machine ID value if the In-house radio button is selected. It gets the company name value if the Outsourced radio button is selected.

      NumberFormatException to catch invalid values (string in an int text field) or an empty text field. If caught, an error message is displayed.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by the Save button saveAddPartButton when clicked by the user
      Throws:
      IOException - from the FXMLoader in the method returnToMainScreen

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      First method to run in this class, and a print message will appear in the command prompt.

      The initialize method is implemented by the Initializable class. Called when the FXMLoader calls the addPartForm FXML file.

      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to retrieve relative paths for the root object (null if location unknown)
      resourceBundle - The resources used to localize the root object (null if root object not localized)
